card.description: A dataset of test results for heart disease patients, used to predict whether or not someone may have heart disease.

context.createdBy: 1. Hungarian Institute of Cardiology. Budapest: Andras Janosi, M.D., University Hospital, Zurich, Switzerland: William Steinbrunn, M.D., University Hospital, Basel, Switzerland: Matthias Pfisterer, M.D., V.A. Medical Center, Long Beach and Cleveland Clinic Foundation: Robert Detrano, M.D., Ph.D.
context.potentialUses: Diagnose whether someone may be at risk for heart disease based on various factors.

fields.description: Whether they have chest pain, and if so whether it is anginal: a feeling like your heart is being squeezed.
Whether or not their fasting blood sugar is high (above 120).
The results of an echycardiogram: whether there are abnormalities detected in their heart.
During an exercise test, the highest the patient's heart rate reached.
Whether or not exercise induced angina in the patient

fields.id: ST Depression Induced By Exercise Relative To Rest
fields.description: The rate of ST depression (artery issues) caused by exercise, an indicator of heart issues.

fields.id: Slope of Peak Exercise ST Segment
fields.description: The slope of their ST segment (the artery being measured) during exercise.

fields.id: Number of Major Vessels Colored by Flourosopy
fields.description: Fluoroscopy is a process of mapping arteries to the heart: this shows how many blood vessels were highly visible in the process. A low or high number may correspond to heart disease.
Whether or not the patient has heart disease.
